page.title: 01A Summary of Our Area
page.content: Our Domesday Block is located north-east of Selby, North Yorkshire, between Barlby and North Duffield. No village lies within its boundaries, only scattered farms and a few houses along the main road, the A163. The most distinctive features of the area are its arable farming land and Skipwith Common, an area of heath, woodland and marsh. The Common is best known for its Nature Reserve, managed by the Yorkshire Wildlife Trust. The recently built Whitemoor Mine is part of the Selby Coalfield. Riccall mine barely brushes the western fringe of the area. Despite the new mine, the area's character remains rural. There are several pig and poultry farms. The place of most historical interest is Danes' Hill, an ancient burial mound.
